data.title: Ebensberger-Fisher Funeral Home
data.text:
Colonel William H. Lewis, USAF (Retired) died on February 14, 2014, in Fair Oaks Ranch, Texas. He was 84 years old.

Col. Lewis was born September 21, 1929, in New Jersey, and completed high school in 1946 at Evansville, Indiana. He enlisted in the U.S. Army on his 17th birthday and served as an Infantry Rifleman. After his discharge, he attended Indiana University where he was commissioned in the US Air Force as a Distinguished Military Graduate. Upon completion of pilot training in 1953, he served as a single engine single seat jet fighter pilot in several assignments in the Air Defense Command, USAF Europe, Tactical Air Command, and Pacific Air Forces.

Col. Lewis received his Master's Degree from Purdue University in 1963, and was also a graduate of the Air Command and Staff College. He was a decorated veteran of the Vietnam Conflict where he commanded an F-105 fighter squadron. His last active duty assignment was in HGS, USAF Security Service, Kelly AFB, Texas, where he retired in 1979 with 31 years of military service.

Col. Lewis was a life member of Phi Kappa Tau Fraternity, Order of Daedalians, Red River Valley Fighter Pilots Association, Air Force Association, The Military Officers Association, F-86 Saber Pilots Association, American Legion, and Veterans of Foreign Wars.

Col. Lewis is survived by his wife, Ann Hawthorne Lewis; sister, Hope C. Lawler and husband William P. of Savannah, Georgia; as well as two nieces and a nephew. He is also survived by a daughter- in-law, Patricia Tufano of Port Orange, Florida. He was preceded in death by two sons, Jon C. and Eric D. Lewis; his parents, Marie and William Lewis; as well as his brother, Donald H. Lewis.

A graveside service is scheduled for Monday, February 24, 2014, at 10:30 a.m. at Ft. Sam Houston National Cemetery in San Antonio, Texas. In lieu of flowers, the family requests that donations be made to Red River Valley Fighter Pilots Association at PO Box 1553, Front Royal, Virginia 22630. To leave condolences for the family, please visit www.ebensberger-fisher.com and select the Obituaries tab.

Arrangements with Ebensberger-Fisher Funeral Home of Boerne, Texas.
